abstract: Carl Icahn is on a roll. Building on a string of successful efforts to push for change at various companies, the billionaire financier has won the endorsement of an influential advisory firm in his face-off with Motorola. Institutional Shareholder Services, which gives voting recommendations to institutional investors, on Wednesday urged the cellphone company’s shareholders to elect Mr. Icahn as a director — despite Motorola’s ardent desire to keep him out of the boardroom.

headline.main: Adviser Backs Icahn for Motorola Board
